snippet: Iraqi legislators approved a new power-sharing government led by the Shiite prime minister, Haider al-Abadi, but they left the two most divisive security posts unfilled, potentially extending a contentious debate.
abstract: Iraqi lawmakers approve new power-sharing government led by Prime Min Haider al-Abadi, but they leave two most divisive security posts unfilled.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Baghdad, and Azam Ahmed from Erbil, Iraq. Ali Hamza and Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Helene Cooper from Ankara, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Iraqi legislators approved a new power-sharing government led by the Shiite prime minister, Haider al-Abadi, but they left the two most divisive security posts unfilled, potentially extending a contentious debate.

headline.main: Lawmakers Approve Cabinet in Iraq, but 2 Posts Are Empty
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Cabinet Approved, but Lawmakers Leave Door Open to Disputes

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
